extendedIngredients.name: brussels sprouts
extendedIngredients.original: 2 pounds brussels sprouts, trimmed, cut in half lengthwise
extendedIngredients.originalName: brussels sprouts, trimmed, cut in half lengthwise

extendedIngredients.name: pecorino
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup (about 4 ounces) coarsely grated young pecorino (such as a young Pecorino Toscano)
extendedIngredients.originalName: cup (about coarsely grated young pecorino (such as a young Pecorino Toscano)

title: Brussels Sprouts with White Beans and Pecorino
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Brussels Sprouts with White Beans and Pecorino a try. This recipe serves 12 and costs 99 cents per serving. One portion of this dish contains around 8g of protein, 14g of fat, and a total of 199 calories. This recipe from Epicurious has 1 fans. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and vegetarian diet. A mixture of garlic cloves, low-salt chicken broth, olive oil, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 25 hours. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 50%. This score is good. Try Brussels Sprouts With White Beans And Pecorino, Shaved Brussels Sprouts, Pecorino, and Prosciutto, and Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Almonds and Pecorino for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Heat 3 tablespoons oil in heavy large skillet over high heat. When just about to smoke, add half of brussels sprouts. Cook until brown, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes. Transfer to large bowl. Heat 3 tablespoons oil in same skillet. Add remaining brussels sprouts, reduce heat to medium-high, and cook until brown, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes. Transfer brussels sprouts to same bowl.                                                                Add remaining 2 tablespoons oil to skillet; increase heat to high. Add garlic; sauté until brown, stirring constantly, about 1 minute. Add broth and brussels sprouts. Cook until brussels sprouts are crisp-tender, stirring frequently, about 3 minutes. Add beans and butter; stir until butter melts and broth is reduced to glaze, about 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in cheese.                                                                         Per serving: 317 calories,  21g fat (6g saturated), 19mg cholesterol, 285mg sodium, 23g carbohydrate, 7g fiber, 13g protein See Nutrition Data's complete analysis of this recipe ›                            Nutritional analysis provided by                                        Nutrition Data

steps.step: Heat 3 tablespoons oil in heavy large skillet over high heat. When just about to smoke, add half of brussels sprouts. Cook until brown, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes.
Heat 3 tablespoons oil in same skillet.
Add remaining brussels sprouts, reduce heat to medium-high, and cook until brown, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes.
Transfer brussels sprouts to same bowl.
Add remaining 2 tablespoons oil to skillet; increase heat to high.
Add garlic; sauté until brown, stirring constantly, about 1 minute.
Add broth and brussels sprouts. Cook until brussels sprouts are crisp-tender, stirring frequently, about 3 minutes.
Add beans and butter; stir until butter melts and broth is reduced to glaze, about 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in cheese.
Per serving: 317 calories,  21g fat (6g saturated), 19mg cholesterol, 285mg sodium, 23g carbohydrate, 7g fiber, 13g protein See Nutrition Data's complete analysis of this recipe ›
